result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L Randall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian L Randall in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Brian L Randall in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF2 and 14CF63 @ 3:10 p.m. Agreement stated - 14CF2 State moves to dismiss and read in ct 1, plead to ct 2, misd THC, court costs. 14CF63 State moves to dismiss and read in ct 1 and ct 4, Def will plead to cts 2 & 3, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation on each, concurrent, costs, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed necessary.  Atty Abernethy-Mays agrees. 44 days credit if revoked. Def will need to waive prelim. Def agrees. 14CF63 - Court reviews prelim rights with Def. Court finds waiver voluntary and knowing. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy recieved, reading waived. Plea questionnaire forms reviewed. 14CF2 ct 2- no contest plea. 14CF63 ct 2 - no contest plea. Ct 3 - no contest plea. Court grants motions to dismiss and read in 14CF1 and 14CFcts 1 & 4. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 14CF2 ct 2 and 14CF63 cts 2 & 3. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. 14CF2 ct 2 - Court costs. No DNA sample or surcharge. 14CF63 same sentence on each ct. Ct 2 sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation. costs - no DNA surcharge. Ct 3  sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, costs, DNA sample and surcharge. AODA and follow through and counseling deemed necessary. 44 days credit if revoked. May transfer probation to Forest Co. Apply bond in 14CF2 to all court costs in both files, balance forfeited to County. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights.

Court calls 14CF2 & 14CF63  @ 1:19 pm.  Defendant Brian L Randall in court, in custody and via video.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives status of cases.  Def. makes statement. Court vacate warrants.  State heard on bond.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond to cover both files w/condition. Def. advised of atty rights.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Warrant cancelled with S.D. - R.D. - 1:34 p.m.

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF2 and 14CF63 @ 11:14 a.m. Def does not appear. Scheduled for 11:00. Atty Abernethy-Mays does not know where Def is and has not had any recent contact. State moves to forfeit bond in 14CF2 and for body only, statewide warrant. Court orders bond forfeited, subject to hearing. Mail notice to last known address. Court orders warrants on both, body only, statewide. State revokes any previous offers to Def.
Status conference on September 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian L Randall
Current: 10804 Sokagon Dr, Mole Lake, WI   (Effective: 07-20-2016)
Prior: 3181 Indian Settlement Road, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Brian L Randall in court via video, with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Brian L Randall in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF2 & 14CF63.  Def is before the court on a warrants.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  State is requesting $2500.00 cash bond for both files.  Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  Statement by Atty Schuster for bond.  Requesting $500.00 cash bond to cover both files.  Court reviews the court files.  Court sets bond.  Waive time limits for preliminary.  Warrants vacated.  Bond covers both files  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
t Withdraw as Counsel of Record - See 14CF2

Defendant Brian L Randall not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant issued. Notices sent to def and poster.  State request bond be forfeited.   Court will forfeit bond to Langlade County

Defendant Brian L Randall not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF2 and 14CF63 @ 10:12 a.m. Scheduled for 9:30 a.m. Atty Bayne-Allison was excused earlier. State moves for body only warrant and bond forfeiture in each case. Court orders body only warrants, state wide in each, and orders both bonds forfeited subject to hearing.

Defendant Brian L Randall in court via video with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Brian L Randall in custody.  Jill L Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint reviewed, waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Arguments for bond presented by Atty Bayne Allison.   Response by State.  Court will reduce bond.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brian L Randall in court, via video in custody.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def has contacted the public defender's office.  Atty is Galen Bayne-Allison.  Court tried to contact atty.  Atty appears by phone.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Court will adj matter.  Bond set at $1000.00 cash.  Issued of bond can be reviewed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
